attributes.action: One Island-One Member of Parliament -please keep our single MP for Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
10 September 2018
Commission's "final recommendations" to divide the Island to have 2 MPs. This is divisive. We need one MP to speak for all of us. One Island - one MP!

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16832323.final-recommendations-for-isle-of-wight-parliamentary-constituencies-revealed/?ref=mr&lp=4
attributes.additional_details:
If you want one MP to support all of us as a united Island with one strong voice in Parliament, please support this petition. 

Thank you very much for your kind help.

attributes.action: Create a National Care Service
attributes.background:
This country needs a sister service to the NHS to focus on social care 

Care of vulnerable and elderly citizens 

Giving  social care a new and unique identity 

This new service would create new and specialised employment with career paths offering a rewarding career with decent pay
attributes.additional_details:
Social care has a poor image , often seen as low paid casual work 
But yet so vital in this age of an older generation 
A new identity a new structure 
With new career paths is needed

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Make smoking while driving illegal
attributes.background: The amount of people that have been killed in forest fires or road traffic collisions is astounding. This is all because someone throws their cigarette butt out of the window of the car. Or is not focusing while driving. I.e trying to light a cigarette.

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attackers.
attributes.background: The act must be premeditated for the attcker to come prepared with acid, the effects are often lifelong and severe, the attacker knows this. Let's put the victim first in this sickening act.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Free Meals For All Kids in Primary Schools
attributes.background: Kids in Primary School should have free Schools meals. If the Prisoners have free meals why kids can’t have them too.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that should be addressed and actioned! 
Please sign my petition and let all kids have a free warm meal at school.

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school

attributes.action: Establish Compulsory Mental Health & Wellbeing Workshops for Secondary Schools
attributes.background: To date, there has been a marked increase in youth related depression and suicide. Taboos against mental health confound public acceptance of mental health issues. This petition aims to address this, starting with the introduction of compulsory mental health workshops to secondary education.
attributes.additional_details:
Sources:

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/wellbeing/adhocs/006721childrensmentalillhealthbytimespentonsocialnetworkingsitesuk2013to2014

https://www.time-to-change.org.uk/blog/why-mental-illness-regarded-taboo-compared-physical-illness

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2009/feb/20/mental-health-taboo

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/millennials-uk-mental-health-depression-world-ranking-second-worst-study-anxiety-a7572026.html

attributes.action: Use the money paid at hospital parkings for the NHS
attributes.background: Hospital parking is so expensive but the public would not begrudge paying it if they knew it would benefit the NHS

attributes.action: The government should require all rail companies to offer part season tickets.
attributes.background: Rail prices continually increase year on year out of line with wage increases. Those working part time are forced to make a choice between accepting sky high day fares or buying season tickets which do not offer good value for money. Women and carers are disproportionately affected.

attributes.action: Force all meat packaging to use images of slaughterhouses to deglamourise meat
attributes.background: Packets of cigarettes after having adopted grotesque images of the effects of smoking in 2008 have reduced the number of smokers significantly in the UK. I am calling on the government to adopt a similar scheme with meat packaging in order to warn people about what they are eating.
attributes.additional_details: Pictures would be stark to illustrate the appalling conditions that animals live in; the effects on health of meat-eating; and the environmental toll that raising animals for meat has.

attributes.action: Re-skill ALL shop floor workers who have been made redundant in 2018 onwards.
attributes.background: Around 30,000 jobs have been lost or at risk since Jan 1 2018. The British Retail Consortium are predicting that up to 1m jobs could be lost or at risk by 2020 in UK Retailing. Every shop worker should be given FREE training to start a new digital career in online retailing.

attributes.action: Give disabled young people more support to get on the housing ladder
attributes.background:
The young persons network in Herefordshire which supports young people to have a voice would like government to consider supporting young people to get onto the housing ladder.

This could be by making more homes accessible throughout the uk and offering funding packages specifically targeted YP
attributes.additional_details:
Our lead was been trying to live independently in a rented/brought house, but has struggled to find suitable housing in his local area.

The only option that he has found so far is buying a house and then having it adapted to suit his needs this could cost thousands.

Unfortunately he is not the only disabled young person in this position thousands of young disabled people across the uk want to live independently in there own home.

I want the govt to make funding ready for accessible homes

attributes.action: The government should give every citizen,young and old,a fresh fruit/veg voucher
attributes.background: The government should give every citizen, young and old, a fresh fruit/veg voucher EACH WEEK to the sum of £25 and this amount should be raised by taxing unhealthy food.
attributes.additional_details: The government should be doing more to encourage people to eat more fresh fruit/veg. This can be easily achieved if all the population, young and old, are given an amount each week so spend solely on this produce. The money required could be raised by the government by raising tax on unhealthy food.

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for care services to be run as for profit companies
attributes.background: The way we treat our elder reflects the way that we as a society, are evolving. I have grown to experience the care sector in England in such a way that it is my firm belief that care services should only be run as community services funded by the people for the people.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a care worker who has worked in different services and supported people with many conditions, lifestyle and backgrounds; who has observed the national health and care crisis and increase in mental health in the the general population, leading to breakdown support networks for many people.
Being a firm believer that all people on Earth are responsible for each other, I urge Parliament to change the law and make it illegal to make a profit out of the lives of vulnerable individuals.

attributes.action: Provide statutory youth services and programs.
attributes.background: There is currently no statutory obligation on local authorities to provide Youth Service Programs in respective Councils across the UK. Recently, this has meant that councils, when faced with Government austerity cuts, have had to slash services to young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to these drastic measures, many Youth Centres in the hearts of our communities have already faced forced closure and hundreds of thousands of young people now face a much-reduced range of services, support, guidance and now lack access to opportunities to acquire critical life skills. 

According to research on the government website london.gov.uk, between 2011 and 2017, at least £39 million has been slashed from council youth service budgets across London. Across 25 councils with similar data, 81 youth centres and major council-supported projects have been cut, and about 800 youth service posts are gone. 

A statutory youth program would mean that the government would proper scrutinize where the money they invest in youth channelled programs would be spent well.

attributes.action: More help available for people who are suffering with mental health issues
attributes.background:
For many of us with mental health we have been failed by the services on offer within the NHS, We are often the ones left to one side. 

Offer more help to people who are admitted to A&E 

make more beds available in hospitals for people with mental health instead of sending us home to suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
We need early intervention available instead of being left until it’s simply to late. 

We need more beds available as many of us who attend A&E are often told that no beds are available or are not even offered one. 

Data compiled for the BBC by NHS Digital showed that between 2011-12 and 2015-16 the number of patients attending A&E units with psychiatric problems rose by nearly 50% to 165,000.

For the under 18s alone the numbers almost doubled to nearly 22,000.

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to 15% when the UK leaves the EU to attract investment
attributes.background:
Once we leave the EU, the UK should reduce corporation tax to 15% This would do the following: 
-Attract new investment from multinational companies 
-Will stop companies leaving the UK due to Brexit 
-Allows companies to invest more money back into the country
-Reduce the unemployment rate

attributes.action: Make a statement on if there will be an extra £350 million per week for our NHS.
attributes.background:
“We send the EU £350 million a week. Let’s fund our NHS instead.”

A recent study by King's College London has shown that 42% of Britons who had heard of this famous claim still believe it.

We demand the Government indicate whether this shall be the case after leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 the UK Statistics Authority debunked the Vote Leave claim that the UK contributes £350 million to the EU each week, and that this full amount could be spent on the NHS. (https://www.statisticsauthority.gov.uk/news/uk-statistics-authority-statement-on-the-use-of-official-statistics-on-contributions-to-the-european-union/)

Despite this, a recent study by King's College has shown that 42% of Britons who had heard of the claim still believe it. (https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/vote-leave-brexit-lies-eu-pay-money-remain-poll-boris-johnson-a8603646.html)

Therefore, it is important for our democracy that the Government issue a statement to eliminate public confusion over the matter.

attributes.action: Cap life insurance premiums for applicants with Mental Health problems.
attributes.background: I was medically discharged from the Armed Forces in 2016 and with this dramatic change in my life I suffered with depression and an adjustment disorder, a problem I still suffer with.  After a battle with myself I finally built up the courage to get the help I needed, but It has now taken me 2 years
attributes.additional_details: to find a company that will actually give me life insurance and within this search was point blank refused cover by multiple insurers.   After allowing an insurer to obtain a targeted medical report from my GP they have offered to cover me, but I was shocked that there was around a 200% premium increase compared to that of my wife’s. The added financial burdens will not only deter people from getting help but will also add more pressure to those affected and may hinder recovery.

attributes.action: Stop the use of plastic milk bottles and return to glass bottles
attributes.background: Plastic milk bottles generate more toxic waste through recycling than the-using 100% recyclable glass milk bottles. Plastic milk bottles are just as bad as non-recyclable plastics and should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details: Refer to BBC program Blue Planet

attributes.action: Introduce impact of humans/plastic on the environment to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: The effect we as a species have on the environment, especially when discussing plastic, is extremely important and may have considerable consequences on the lives of today's children. Educating them will help them understand how to help and protect the environment and their future.
attributes.additional_details: The response from people of all ages after watching David Attenborough's Blue Planet II was overwhelming - people want to change the way we use plastic. However children of a primary school age do not necessarily have access to the information provided by the series. Educating all children across the country allows them to make their own judgements on what is right or wrong for the future of plastics and inform them for when they're old enough to vote on such matters.

attributes.action: Ban websites supporting and promoting eating disorders, suicide and self harm
attributes.background:
The internet these days are widely accessed by all ages. This allows vulnerable and young people to access harmful content promoting and sharing ideas towards eating disorders, self harm and suicide. 
We would like the government to impose a ban on accessing such sites in the UK
attributes.additional_details: https://www.healthyplace.com/abuse/self-injury/why-pro-self-injury-pro-self-harm-websites-are-dangerous

attributes.action: Water safety & effects of cold water to be taught to teenagers
attributes.background: In 2018 we have seen a increase in the amount of deaths in water from cold water shock and drowning, This increase is due to the hot weather we have had. This makes it more worrying that none really trains members of the community or school children on the dangers of open water and how to stay safe.
attributes.additional_details:
We really need to train youngsters and adults in the dangers of cold water shock, this can be triggered by jumping into the water which holds its temperature between 10 degrees - 15 degrees, 

The biggest danger is inhaling water and drowning, even if the water is flat, calm and you know how to swim. Cold Water Shock causes an immediate loss of breathing control. You take one or more huge gasps, followed by hyperventilation – very rapid breathing that is hard or impossible for you to control.

attributes.action: In further public vote on course of leaving the EU, "Remain" not an option shown
attributes.background:
In a referendum held too recently the decision was made, many many thousands more than wanting to remain, voted in favour to leave the EU. An further vote should be a progression of this, not regression.

Remain term is ambiguous, rejoining EU now would not mean a status quo.
attributes.additional_details:
Options for voting on should focus on leave directions, for example; current negotiated deal, EEA (Norway) interim deal building to Canada plus, or no deal

Remain term is ambiguous, rejoining EU now would not mean a status quo - increased fee, shared army, joining eurozone, damage to the UK economy would increase in likelihood.

attributes.action: Review the use of Palm Oil in products consumed in the UK and it’s taxation.
attributes.background: Palm oil is widely used in everyday products, I believe more can be done to protect areas destroyed for palm oil plantations. I am requesting to UK to set the trend of reviewing the use and availability of palm oil including its taxation.

attributes.action: Reopen the Exeter to Plymouth Railway line via Okehampton
attributes.background:
Exeter to Plymouth has currently one railway line connecting two big cities. The current railway line in bad weather is always being closed to trains. This cuts off Plymouth and Cornwall from the rest of the country.
Reopening the Okehampton route will help the situation.

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Require fathers who pay child support to be named on the birth certificate.
attributes.background: It seems today we have a very unfair systems in which a resident parent can prevent a non-resident parent from having any rights, prevent visitation and still claim money.
attributes.additional_details:
If a mother knows who the father is, it should be a requirement that they are named on the birth certificate, before any claims for child support can be made. 
Today we talk about how everyone should be treated equally, yet it seems unless you're the father of child out of wedlock. It equality of parents has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Scrap free television licences for the over-75s
attributes.background: According to Lord Hall of Birkenhead, the over-75s consume many more BBC services than others, yet are not required to pay for a television licence. This means households that are not eligible for a free licence are being forced to subsidise the over-75s which amounts to age discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: According to TV Licensing there were 4,455,000 over-75s licences in force in 2017. At the current cost of £150.50 per licence, this represents a total cost of £670 million that is covered by households that pay for a television licence.

attributes.action: Introduce conjugal visits in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In many other countries conjugal visits are permitted. However, in the U.K. it is not permitted. the biggest advantages of allowing conjugal visits is prisoners tend to follow the rules for fear of losing their right to have a visit. Moreover, the biggest advantage is families no longer suffer.
attributes.additional_details: Conjugal visits are allowed in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, Germany, india, Israel, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Spain. In the US, conjugal visits are not allowed in Federal prisons, but California, New York, Mississippi, Washington, and Connecticut permit them.

attributes.action: Help end the scarcity of landlords who will accept the housing element of UC.
attributes.background: Removing a tenant's choice to have housing benefit paid directly to a landlord has meant that few landlords are prepared to house claimants. I fear this will continue (within UC) to contribute to homelessness for many and cause a number of deaths via exposure this winter.
attributes.additional_details: I completely understand the ethos behind encouraging those receiving benefits to take increasing levels of financial responsibility and to work towards independent living. However, the increased uncertainty for landlords caused by the freeze on LHA rates, and the strong preference towards the allowance being paid to the claimant, disadvantages vulnerable adults and leaves many trapped in addiction and homelessness. https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN07008

attributes.action: Create a UK group to design, construct and operate UK nuclear power stations
attributes.background: 51% of all electricity generated in UK is by Gas and Coal powered stations. 21% is generated by old Nuclear plants. We need to replace these with new nuclear power stations. I believe that the UK should design, develop, construct and operate these with UK skills by creating a UK Nuclear Power Group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government should create a UK Nuclear Power Group to manage, design, develop, construct and operate the new Nuclear power stations required for our UK national electricity grid. 
A UK group would not only create thousands of jobs in the UK, using the skills that are developed in the UK and ensure the security of the electric network remained in our control.

attributes.action: H M Forces Veterans ID Card
attributes.background: Following many years loyal service in H M Forces, indeed having been willing to give their life for their country, I think it is time H M Government recognised this service for all veterans by establishing an official MoD H M Forces Form 90V ID card for all those who have served.
attributes.additional_details: The ID card should show the service (RAF, Army etc.), the rank on retiring, dates of service, photo, signature and date of birth, to therefore make it a fully recognised VIC (Veterans Identity Card). The card should also include a PIN facility for electronic use.

attributes.action: Make the legal drinking age for citizens of the UK 16
attributes.background: Youths across the UK already drink without a responsible adult present.

attributes.action: All staff in semh schools to be MHFA trained and a minimum of 7 inset days.
attributes.background: SEMH schools have students with varying needs that are written into an EHCP. It's only right that adequate mandatory training is available to all staff to help these students especially with the varying mental health needs. Funding and timing is a major factor, therefore more inset days are needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 of us are diagnosed with a MH illness at some point. 50% off these diagnosed needs are displayed at the age of 14. Semh schools deal with a lot of these students that display these needs alongside other needs. To help these students and to give them the best they deserve, it should be mandatory that EVERY member of staff is MHFA trained to recognise and deal with students that are in crisis. These members of staff are the early help for most of these students.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclists must wear crash helmets
attributes.background: Make it law that all cyclists must wear protective headwear when out on the road.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 - the last year for which statistics relating to accidents caused by cyclists are available - two pedestrians were killed and 96 seriously injured after being hit by a bicycle. But every year more than 100 cyclists are killed and more than 3,000 seriously injured on British roads – the majority by motorists.

attributes.action: School should start at 10am as teenagers are too tired
attributes.background: Teenagers are so tired due to having to wake up very early to get to school. The Government should require secondary schools to start later, which will lead to increased productivity at school.

attributes.action: Zero VAT on low sugar snacks for kids/adults <5g/100g.
attributes.background:
The UK is full of high sugar snacks and is suffering an Obesity epidemic- why are VAT Free Junk foods are allowed?
High sugar treats must be VAT rated. VAT should be zero rated for healthy snacks for children/adults  eg. roasted nuts, raisins, frozen yoghurt, protein bars and diabetic chocolate.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 kids are obese by the time they leave primary school! This leads to more issues, e.g. low self-esteem, health/welfare issues.
1 in 13 deaths relate to obesity
Who Is Obese in the UK?
66% Adults
25% 2-10 year olds
33% 11-15 year olds

The NHS in England spent £6.1 billion on overweight and obesity-related ill-health in 2014 to 15. We spend more each year on the treatment of obesity and diabetes than we do on the police, fire service and judicial system combined.The overall cost of obesity to the wider society is estimated at £27 billion.
https://publichealthmatters.blog.gov.uk/2017/03/31/health-matters-obesity-and-the-food-environment/

The VAT free status on any high sugary foods/ snacks/ treats has to stop. 
VAT on healthy foods has to be made VAT free.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people who kill others and rape children.
attributes.background: Many rapists go into prison and then come out to commit the same crime which is a massive issue with the system today many rape victims feel scared their rapist will try to attack them again. These people who commit these crimes shouldn't be allowed back into society.

attributes.action: Pass a law restricting the promotion and display of alcoholic beverages in shops
attributes.background: Shops must be more responsible by not displaying alcoholic beverages at the front of the shop where people are forced to pass by it. They should limit the use of promotional marketing so as not to encourage people to purchase alcohol, particularly vulnerable & disadvantaged people in society.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands die from alcohol-related diseases every year. The cost and burden on the NHS is vast. It is the second biggest preventable killer behind smoking. The negative impact of alcohol is worse than smoking because it takes away a persons dignity, self esteem and ruins the lives of family and loved ones. Banning advertising of cigarettes has reduced smoking-related illness. Alcohol should be no different. For example, Tesco should not be having a 'Drinks Festival' a campaign encouraging people to drink.

attributes.action: Allow England to form a devolved Government.
attributes.background: Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales have freedom to make their own decisions and choices with a devolved democracy. England however has to follow the laws that Westminster agrees. It is not fair that these countries get to vote and have an input on decisions that affect our lives but not their own.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g Scotland can contribute to the decision over the future of our NHS, something of which doesn't not affect themselves.
If we had a devolved democracy, England would have the right to freedom. Let our lives be determined by our own decisions and not because of others; with a devolved democracy this is made possible.

attributes.action: Allow vehicle tax to remain with the vehicle upon transfer of ownership.
attributes.background:
When the DVLA stopped issuing paper tax disc the ability to transfer vehicle tax to a new owner was also removed. 
This means that in many cases the tax is paid by both the seller and buyer for the month the car changes hands.

attributes.action: Require teachers to wear a uniform
attributes.background: Pupils have to wear uniforms for numerous reasons and if not are punished and sent home even if parents cannot afford it. I think it would be fair for teachers to have to wear them too to set examples to the students and also for security reasons to help prevent non staff members being on site.
attributes.additional_details: When not supposed to be on site, it will also help them to be identified by the pupils and parents etc. I strongly believe that figures in authority should lead by the examples they lead and follow the same rules as the pupils with uniforms and piercing and hair cuts etc police ambulance firefighters etc all wear uniforms so teachers should too.

attributes.action: Allow Industrial Hemp to be grown without a Home Office License (4 plants)
attributes.background: I propose a registered scheme with local police to allow UK adults to grow 4 plants of Industrial Hemp ONLY at home without a Home Office License. With tested seeds that are below 0.2% THC. Allowing individuals to grow safe CBD Hemp at home for personal use only . With labelled & tagged plants.
attributes.additional_details:
Iskedjian et al. Meta-analysis of cannabis based treatments for neuropathic and multiple sclerosis-related pain. Curr Med Res Opin. 23(1):17-24.(2007).
 Bergamaschi et al. Safety and side effects of cannabidiol, a Cannabis sativa constituent. Curr Drug Saf. 2011 Sep 1;6(4):237-49.

The fact there has never been a single recorded case of a death caused by CBD or even a psychotic episode caused by CBD . I am in no way endorsing Recreational Cannabis , but urging you to consider this alternative.

attributes.action: Introduce a goverment helpline for mental health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will expirence a mental health issue each year. Why don’t we have a goverment helpline, like 999, for people expirencing a problem or crisis? We need to do more to help people.

attributes.action: Raise awareness towards borderline personality disorder (BPD).
attributes.background: Borderline Personality Disorder(BPD) affects people of all ages and it is brought on by previous traumatic experiences that cause/caused instability within someone's life. Those who suffer with BPD don't usually realise until late into adolescents, around 1 in 10 diagnosed end up committing suicide
attributes.additional_details: More awareness and understanding needs to be made available nationally to ensure that this number decreases. This is one of many mental health issues within the UK that is unheard of and for the most part, unknown. Often overlooked as Depression or Anxiety, BPD needs both awareness and more accurate diagnoses. We hope with this petition this can become a reality.
